title: rhomelmabini
author: rhomelmabini
content: May I know here what are the projects you're farming on Injective Protocol lately? I think Injective will be huge next year and want to maximize the opportunity to farm some projects that hasn't launch their token yet or was still at Testnet or those who confirmed an airdrop.

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: You can use perp exchange Helix: https://helixapp.com/, I used it a month's ago and it made me eligible for Pyth airdrop, which was completely unexpected. Fun fact: Back when I used it, I was in dilemma whether to long $osmo or $inj, I longed osmo meanwhile $inj is 15x since then.

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on December 16, 2023, 02:04:48 PMYou can use perp exchange Helix: https://helixapp.com/, I used it a month's ago and it made me eligible for Pyth airdrop, which was completely unexpected. Fun fact: Back when I used it, I was in dilemma whether to long $osmo or $inj, I longed osmo meanwhile $inj is 15x since then. Really new to this and thanks for stopping by and the tip this will be good for those who wanna farm through these airdrops. Yeah, INJ has been in a good run and already did a 6x and for me that's a huge indicator that it would be good in this bull run as well.

comments.author: bluebit25
comments.body: I'm also using https://coinhall.org/ again, although I previously favored Terra but you know what happened.And recently with the development of Injective, it is not excluded that this service will carry out airdrops in the future, and currently, according to what I observe, some development teams are also gradually moving to coinhall to work.

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: Quote from: bluebit25 on December 19, 2023, 11:18:19 AMI'm also using https://coinhall.org/ again, although I previously favored Terra but you know what happened.And recently with the development of Injective, it is not excluded that this service will carry out airdrops in the future, and currently, according to what I observe, some development teams are also gradually moving to coinhall to work.Thanks for sharing it here with us @bluebit25, that's a great addition. Well, there's the thing with inscriptions as well and it was likely the cause that there has been a pause on withdrawal on some CEX with INJ, TIA, etc., and wallet like Keplr has recent issues because of it. Not familiar yet with coinhall and likely with these stuffs, they're new but I think they're worth exploring.

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: You may also stake $INJ to qualify for airdrops, since Injective price is soaring high, projects may reward for staking it merely. There is already one announced from Nois [1] for $INJ stakers. Let's see how much it'll be worth. [1] https://twitter.com/NoisRNG

comments.author: disconnectme
comments.body: Injective protocol has generated a lot of noise recently due to the rise in the token price and a lot of people are projecting it is going to be the next blockchain to farm airdrops, the issue I have with he chain is that, it still has a long way to go, most of the dapps on it are far from the best on Solana and Ethereum. I will wait before moving my money to the chain

comments.author: ice18
comments.body: Staking INJ is one of the most effective way to be eligible for airdrops try staking atleast $100 using validators that may airdrop tokens like @BlackPanther_Fi you can also deposit liquidity for more points , try also buying NFTs at https://injective.talis.art/ who knows this will also add to future airdrop criteria.

comments.author: Sophokles
comments.created_time: December 24, 2023, 11:58:04 AMLast edit: December 24, 2023, 12:09:46 PM by Sophokles
comments.body: There is still hype about the INJ ecosystem airdrop but i think it is too late for that. There is manta network airdrop hype going around too so better keep an eye on that as well. The TVL already grows to around 80M and the number is still growing. There are so many new project that have recently been added to manta's ecosystem and there is a ecosystem incentive in manta network as well. That means users will also get an airdrop if they interact with manta's ecosystem project as well. You need real money to do that so that eliminates all the airdrop farmer bots which can lead to massive airdrop for the real users of the ecosystem.

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: Quote from: Sophokles on December 24, 2023, 11:58:04 AMYou need real money to do that so that eliminates all the airdrop farmer bots which can lead to massive airdrop for the real users of the ecosystem.That's untrue, airdrop farmers can and do use real money to farm airdrops.

comments.author: ice18
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on December 25, 2023, 02:33:48 AMQuote from: Sophokles on December 24, 2023, 11:58:04 AMYou need real money to do that so that eliminates all the airdrop farmer bots which can lead to massive airdrop for the real users of the ecosystem.That's untrue, airdrop farmers can and do use real money to farm airdrops. Yeah I agree there are thousands of sibyls for big airdrops like this its so easy to create multiple wallets to farm airdrops the only problem if you did have enough money to take risk, some whales are doing this they are spending a lot of money like thousands of dollars I saw this movements from Arbitrum airdrops, they are profiting really huge amount.

comments.author: jaberwock
comments.body: Quote from: ice18 on December 25, 2023, 02:52:54 AMQuote from: libert19 on December 25, 2023, 02:33:48 AMQuote from: Sophokles on December 24, 2023, 11:58:04 AMYou need real money to do that so that eliminates all the airdrop farmer bots which can lead to massive airdrop for the real users of the ecosystem.That's untrue, airdrop farmers can and do use real money to farm airdrops. Yeah I agree there are thousands of sibyls for big airdrops like this its so easy to create multiple wallets to farm airdrops the only problem if you did have enough money to take risk, some whales are doing this they are spending a lot of money like thousands of dollars I saw this movements from Arbitrum airdrops, they are profiting really huge amount.  That wasn't easy then, if we need lots of money. Even before we know it, the project is already ahead of us. They know that airdrops are hot now, so maybe this is one of their ways to earn more profit? Even though I know that whales has a bigger budget, it was still my first time to know that they also farm airdrops lol.I guess because I think it's too time-consuming, because you know, you are going to create multiple wallets and put in different information. I really thought they are only good at manipulating crypto prices. But they deserved their huge earnings because they took a huge risk there. No need to be jealous at them  .

comments.author: GreatArkansas
comments.body: https://defillama.com/chain/InjectiveIn Defi Lllama, you can see some projects or platforms under Injective Protocol right now. As I can see, there are still a few of them there. So for me, it's worth to try on any platforms here for sure, I highly suggest to verify each platform that they are legit and they still don't have yet released any altcoins.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: GreatArkansas on December 29, 2023, 02:20:15 AMhttps://defillama.com/chain/InjectiveIn Defi Lllama, you can see some projects or platforms under Injective Protocol right now. As I can see, there are still a few of them there. So for me, it's worth to try on any platforms here for sure, I highly suggest to verify each platform that they are legit and they still don't have yet released any altcoins.Doing tasks for airdrops must be done with new wallets.Interactions with new platforms, new smart contracts, must be done with new wallets.If using (not new) wallets, with big fund inside, to interact with new platforms, new smart contracts, people will put their wallets at risk and they can lose funds in these wallets. If fund is big, like all money they have, it's terrible.Trying with airdrops is good, like trying lottery tickets but don't risk your funds with it.

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: Quote from: jaberwock on December 26, 2023, 05:12:34 AMThat wasn't easy then, if we need lots of money. Even before we know it, the project is already ahead of us. They know that airdrops are hot now, so maybe this is one of their ways to earn more profit? Even though I know that whales has a bigger budget, it was still my first time to know that they also farm airdrops lol.I guess because I think it's too time-consuming, because you know, you are going to create multiple wallets and put in different information. I really thought they are only good at manipulating crypto prices. But they deserved their huge earnings because they took a huge risk there. No need to be jealous at them  .Not really time consuming, if you have money to spare there are automated tools available to farm airdrops these days. Quote from: BlackBoss_ on December 29, 2023, 02:24:12 AMDoing tasks for airdrops must be done with new wallets.Interactions with new platforms, new smart contracts, must be done with new wallets.If using (not new) wallets, with big fund inside, to interact with new platforms, new smart contracts, people will put their wallets at risk and they can lose funds in these wallets. If fund is big, like all money they have, it's terrible.Trying with airdrops is good, like trying lottery tickets but don't risk your funds with it.Projects usually filter out new wallets. Secure your funds in new wallet, but keep using your oldest one to hunt for airdrops, using new wallets to interact is easies way to get disqualified.
